value.title: What is Infrastructure as Code? | One Dev Question: Abel Wang
value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Cloud Developer Advocate Abel Wang explains how Azure DevOps provides developer services to support teams to plan work, collaborate on code development, and build and deploy applications. In this video, Abel explains the concepts of Infrastructure as Code (IaC).   Get
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/uETq8KKVUFY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 4: Describe general security and network security features
value.excerpt: Learn about the various Azure services you can use to help ensure that your cloud resources are safe, secure, and trusted.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces you to the basics of Azure.

topItems.title: Protect against security threats on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure can help you protect the workloads that you run both in the cloud and in your on-premises datacenter.

topItems.title: Secure network connectivity on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the Azure services you can use to help ensure that your network is safe, secure, and trusted.

value.title: Implement a secure environment for a database service
value.excerpt: Implement SQL Server-based options for authentication and authorization, as well as Azure options for securing Azure SQL databases. Explore encryption, firewalls and advanced threat protection.

topItems.title: Configure database authentication and authorization
topItems.excerpt: Contrast authentication using Azure Active Directory vs Windows Active Directory vs SQL Server authentication. Implement various security principals and configure permissions.

topItems.title: Protect data in-transit and at rest
topItems.excerpt: Protect data in-transit and at rest

topItems.title: Implement compliance controls for sensitive data
topItems.excerpt: Explore data classification capabilities and degrees of confidentiality. Explore and configure advanced threat protection options, including SQL Injection.

value.title: Migrate ASP.NET Apps to Azure
value.excerpt: Migrate ASP.NET web applications and their data to Azure App Service and Azure SQL Database to take advantage of the cloud.

topItems.title: Migrate an on-premises web application to Azure App Service
topItems.excerpt: Use the Azure App Service Migration Assistant to assess the readiness of a web app to be deployed on App Service, and perform the migration.

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

value.title: Safeguard cloud resources
value.excerpt: The third and final learning path in a course on Cloud Administration from Carnegie Mellon University. Learn to monitor your cloud resources, keep them safe, and protect or recover them in the case of a disaster.

topItems.title: Monitor cloud resources
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Monitoring how your cloud resources are performing is crucial to building reliable cloud applications. This module covers what monitoring is, why you need to do it, and how you can about monitoring your resources.

topItems.title: Cloud security
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Keeping your cloud secure means more than just adding permissions to resources. Learn about what cloud security means, including threats, cryptography, and regulation.

topItems.title: Disaster recovery and backup
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. What do you do when something goes wrong with your resources on the cloud? How do you prepare for such an issue? Learn about disaster backup and recovery with this module.

value.title: Analyze receipts with the Form Recognizer service
value.excerpt: Processing invoices and receipts is a common task in many business scenarios. Increasingly, organizations are turning to artificial intelligence (AI) to automate data extraction from scanned receipts.

value.title: Analyze text with the Text Analytics service
value.excerpt: The Text Analytics service is a cloud-based service that provides advanced natural language processing over raw text for sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction, named entity recognition, and language detection.

value.title: Applications and infrastructure migration and modernization
value.excerpt: Every modern business is powered by applications, such as internal procurement applications, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems, retail websites, and third-party products. As your business prepares for digital transformation, it’s important to begin modernizing and migrating your applications and infrastructure to the cloud. Azure is a key component of that process. You can choose to migrate, modernize, or build cloud native solutions depending on your business goals and how you assess your application portfolio. This is a strategic decision. You’ll be able to choose the path that’s right for your organization.

value.title: Dynamically meet changing web app performance requirements with autoscale rules
value.excerpt: Respond to periods of high activity by incrementally adding resources, and then removing these resources when activity drops, to reduce costs.

value.title: Explore Azure compute services
value.excerpt: Learn about the different services that are available in Azure Compute.

value.title: Introduction to Azure Logic Apps
value.excerpt: Learn how to evaluate Logic Apps as an automation choice for your organization using criteria for integration, performance, conditionals, and connectors.

value.title: Explore Azure networking services
value.excerpt: Learn about the core networking resources that are available in Azure, such as Virtual Networks, VPN Gateway, and ExpressRoute.

value.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools
value.excerpt: Learn how to create SQL elastic pools and how to use them to manage performance and cost for a collection of SQL databases.

value.title: Explore Azure Storage services
value.excerpt: Learn about the different storage options that are available in Azure Storage.

value.title: Edit code through branching and merging in Git
value.excerpt: Level up your Git knowledge by learning about how to keep code separate using branches and how to merge them later

value.title: Choose an Agile approach to software development
value.excerpt: Learn with the Space Game web team how to use Azure Boards to implement Agile software practices along with DevOps transparency and collaboration.

value.title: Choose a compute provisioning solution for your application
value.excerpt: Discover the services and tools available to automate the deployment and configuration of your Azure infrastructure.

value.title: Choose the appropriate API for Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Compare the different APIs that are available in Azure Cosmos DB, highlighting and contrasting the different scenarios that would make them a good choice for a company.

value.title: Choose the right disk storage for your virtual machine workload
value.excerpt: Azure provides a variety of disk storage options for virtual machine workloads. Identify the features of capabilities of each type to ensure your application performs optimally.

value.title: Disaster recovery and backup
value.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. What do you do when something goes wrong with your resources on the cloud? How do you prepare for such an issue? Learn about disaster backup and recovery with this module.

value.title: Monitor cloud resources
value.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Monitoring how your cloud resources are performing is crucial to building reliable cloud applications. This module covers what monitoring is, why you need to do it, and how you can about monitoring your resources.

value.title: Understand virtualization
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

value.title: Configure database authentication and authorization
value.excerpt: Contrast authentication using Azure Active Directory vs Windows Active Directory vs SQL Server authentication. Implement various security principals and configure permissions.

value.title: Manage and control traffic flow in your Azure deployment with routes
value.excerpt: Learn how to control Azure virtual network traffic by implementing custom routes.

value.title: Build a .NET Core app for Azure Cosmos DB in Visual Studio Code
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a .NET Core application to store and query data in Azure Cosmos DB by using Visual Studio Code.

value.title: Process images with the Computer Vision service
value.excerpt: Use the Computer Vision API to analyze images for insights, extract text from images, and generate high-quality thumbnails.

value.title: Create an Azure Cosmos DB database built to scale
value.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure Cosmos DB account, database, and container built to scale as your application grows.

value.title: Create a new Node.js project and work with dependencies
value.excerpt: Create a Node.js project and learn to add packages and manage package dependencies in your project. Use the NPM CLI and registry to add libraries and tools to your JavaScript/TypeScript applications using Visual Studio Code.

value.title: Orchestrate machine learning with pipelines
value.excerpt: Create pipelines in Azure Machine Learning

value.title: Create a release pipeline in Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Set up a continuous delivery (CD) pipeline that automates the process of deploying your application.
